com.github.dkharrat.nexusdata.core

Class ObjectContext

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.dkharrat.nexusdata.core.ObjectContext

  • public class ObjectContext
extends Object
    An Object Context keeps track and manages a collection of objects used by an application. A context represents a "scratchpad" where changes to objects can be made. Through a context, an object can be fetched from a persistence store. Changes can be made to those objects. Also, new objects can be inserted, or existing objects can be deleted. Any such changes can be either committed to the persistence store or discarded if they are not needed anymore. Every managed object is registered with an ObjectContext. You can also have multiple object contexts. An object can exist in multiple object contexts. However, each context will maintain its own copy of the object. This means, an object can be edited in more than one context simultaneously. Note that, conflict resolution is currently not supported. So, if two contexts track an object, each having different changes to the object, then saving the second context after the first one is saved, will override any changes from the first.

    An ObjectContext is not thread-safe, thus it must not be shared between multiple threads. Instead, create a new context for each thread that needs to work with ManagedObjects. This implies that each thread will maintain their own copies of the ManagedObjects to work with. Object changes from each context can be reflected on other contexts through merging the changes upon receiving an ObjectsChangedNotification.

        storeCoordinator - the associated PersistenceStoreCoordinator that will be used to retrieve objects and save objects to

    • Method Detail

      • getPersistentStoreCoordinator

        public PersistentStoreCoordinator getPersistentStoreCoordinator()
        Returns:
        The associated persistent store coordinator

      • newFetchRequestBuilder

        public <T extends ManagedObject> FetchRequest.Builder<T> newFetchRequestBuilder(Class<T> entityType)
        Returns a fetch request builder for the specified entity type, which can be used to build upon more constraints if desired.
        Type Parameters:
        T - parametrized type of the entity
        Parameters:
        entityType - the type of the entity to be fetched
        Returns:
        a fetch request builder for the specified entity type

      • executeFetchOperation

        public <T extends ManagedObject> List<T> executeFetchOperation(FetchRequest<T> fetchRequest)
        Fetches all objects that match the specified criteria from the persistence store coordinator. If the fetch request does not contain a predicate, all objects for the specified entity will be returned. Returned objects will maintain whatever state they are in before the fetch operation (i.e. objects will have the changes that have been made within the context, if any, and not the state from the persistence store). Objects pending deletion in the context will not be included in the returned results.
        Type Parameters:
        T - parametrized type of the entity to be fetched
        Parameters:
        fetchRequest - the fetch request that specifies the criteria
        Returns:
        a list of objects that match the criteria

      • findAll

        public <T extends ManagedObject> List<T> findAll(Class<T> type)
        Returns all objects of the specified entity type from the persistent store.
        Type Parameters:
        T - parametrized type of the entity to be fetched
        Parameters:
        type - The class type of the entity to retrieve
        Returns:
        a list of all the objects that match the specified entity type

      • findAll

        public <T extends ManagedObject> List<T> findAll(Class<T> type,
                                        Predicate predicate)
        Returns all objects of the specified entity type from the persistent store that match a predicate.
        Type Parameters:
        T - parametrized type of the entity to be fetched
        Parameters:
        type - The class type of the entity to retrieve
        predicate - The predicate to test against
        Returns:
        a list of all the objects that match the specified entity type and predicate

      • objectWithID

        public ManagedObject objectWithID(ObjectID id)
        Returns the object that has the specified ID. If the object is not registered with the context, a new instance will be created and returned as a fault. It is assumed that the object exists in the persistence store. If not, an exception will be thrown when a fault is triggered (e.g. by accessing any property in the object).
        Parameters:
        id - The object's ID
        Returns:
        The object with the specified ID

      • objectWithID

        public ManagedObject objectWithID(URI objectIDUri)
        Similar to objectWithID(ObjectID) except this method uses the URI representation for the ID.
        Parameters:
        objectIDUri - The URI representation of the object ID
        Returns:
        The object with the specified ID

      • getExistingObject

        public ManagedObject getExistingObject(ObjectID id)
        Returns the object that has the specified ID. If the object is not registered with the context, it is fetched from the persistence store and faulted into the context. An exception will be thrown if the object does not exist.
        Parameters:
        id - The object's ID
        Returns:
        The object with the specified ID

      • getExistingObject

        public ManagedObject getExistingObject(URI objectIDUri)
        Similar to getExistingObject(ObjectID) except this method uses the URI representation for the ID.
        Parameters:
        objectIDUri - The URI representation of the object ID
        Returns:
        The object with the specified ID

      • newObject

        public <T extends ManagedObject> T newObject(Class<T> type)
        Creates a new object of the specified type. The object will automatically be inserted into this context, to be saved to the persistence store the next time the context is saved. Therefore, it is not necessary to call insert(ManagedObject) for the object.
        Parameters:
        type - the class type of the entity to create
        Returns:
        a new object instance

      • getRegisteredObjects

        public Set<ManagedObject> getRegisteredObjects()
        Returns the objects that are registered with this context.
        Returns:
        the set of objects that are registered with this context

      • insert

        public void insert(ManagedObject object)
        Specifies that the object is to be inserted into the persistence store the next time the context is saved. If the object was already inserted into this context, the operation is ignored.
        Parameters:
        object - the object to be inserted
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the object is already associated with another context, or if the object was not created from a context

      • delete

        public void delete(ManagedObject object)
        Specifies that the object is to be removed from its persistence store the next time the context is saved. If the object was already marked for deletion in this context, the operation is ignored. If the object has not been saved to the persistence store yet, the object is simply deleted from the context.
        Parameters:
        object - the object to be inserted

      • obtainPermanentIDsForObjects

        public void obtainPermanentIDsForObjects(Collection<ManagedObject> objects)
        Assigns permanent IDs for the specified objects. Objects that already have a permanent ID are ignored. A permanent ID is used to uniquely identify an object in the persistence store. Usually, newly created objects will have temporary IDs. It is not necessary to call this method directly on newly created objects, as permanent IDs will be obtained for them before they are persisted to the store.
        Parameters:
        objects - The list of objects

      • save

        public void save()
        Commits all unsaved changes of the registered objects to their associated persistence store.

      • hasChanges

        public boolean hasChanges()
        Indicates whether there are any unsaved changes to any object in this context.
        Returns:
        true if there are unsaved changes, or false otherwise.

      • getInsertedObjects

        public Set<ManagedObject> getInsertedObjects()
        Returns the set of objects that are pending insertion to the persistence store.
        Returns:
        the set of objects that are pending insertion to the persistence store

      • getUpdatedObjects

        public Set<ManagedObject> getUpdatedObjects()
        Returns the set of objects that have unsaved changes and haven't been persisted yet.
        Returns:
        the set of objects that have unsaved changes

      • getDeletedObjects

        public Set<ManagedObject> getDeletedObjects()
        Returns the set of objects that are pending deletion from the persistence store.
        Returns:
        the set of objects that are pending deletion from the persistence store

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Discards all the unsaved changes made to the objects in this context, including objects that are pending insertion or deletion.

      • mergeChangesFromSaveNotification

        public void mergeChangesFromSaveNotification(ChangedObjectsSet changedObjects)
        Merges all the changes that been made through another context. This is done by refreshing any objects that have been updated outside of this context, faulting-in newly inserted objects, and removing deleted objects.
        Parameters:
        changedObjects - the ChangedObjectsSet that was received from a save notification

      • cloneObject

        public ManagedObject cloneObject(ManagedObject otherObject)
        Clones the specified object. The cloned object is then inserted into this context.

        Note: Only the object attributes are copied over; relationships are skipped.

        Parameters:
        otherObject - The object to copy from.
        Returns:
        the cloned and newly inserted object
